reviews.review_msg: She was extremely rude and made multiple vicious comments about student's abilities in class and in private emails. We paid good money to learn biology, not to be personally criticized about our intelligence. It's unfortunate that she refuses to take responsibility for her lack of clarity and bizarre, fluctuating expectations.
Worst prof I've encountered at SFU.  She was mean and made fun of students in front of the entire class.  Her exams were okay but she said the class was stupid when the average was so low.

Very nice, funny prof.  Exam questions are not hard, but she really picks random things you normally wouldn't think would be on exam...so you must study every little detail.  Also, tough marker in that she wants exact answers; hard to get part marks.
I enjoyed this course mainly because of the content. Her notes are clear but still have to go to her classes. She is a hard marker, but as long as you know your stuff, you'll be fine.
Fantastic prof.  Lectures are taped, but it's worth showing up just to watch (he's cute!).  Tests are long, but fair.  Very approachable guy outside of class.
Interesting lectures; Tests are average, but tend to be long.  It's worth showing up just for the sexy English accent!
This was the most awesome class i ever took
completely unorganized and couldn't explain a concept if his life depended on it
